events.message: The insured reported a vehicle collision that occurred on March 30th involving their car and another vehicle at an intersection.
The claim was categorised under 'Auto Accident' according to the nature of the vehicle collision described in the report.
An experienced claims agent was assigned to the auto accident case to ensure proper handling and timely updates to the customer.
The insured received official acknowledgment from the insurance company regarding the receipt of the auto accident claim.
Request sent to the insured for photos of vehicle damage, police accident report, and driver’s license copy for claim verification purposes.
The insured submitted all requested documents including accident photographs, police report, and their driver’s license, which helped progress the claim.
Claims investigator initiated the examination of the submitted evidence and began contacting witnesses to establish fault in the vehicle collision.
The accident investigation concluded with no indication of fraud; fault was assigned to the other party involved in the collision.
A settlement offer was proposed to cover all vehicle repairs and rental car costs until the insured’s vehicle is drivable again.
The insured expressed satisfaction with the timely settlement proposal and the transparent communication throughout the claim process.
Management approved the claim settlement to be issued as per the agreed terms, allowing for the immediate repair of the damaged vehicle.
The payment covering vehicle repairs and rental costs was successfully disbursed to the insured’s account, closing the financial aspect of the claim.
The auto accident claim was officially closed following payment, with confirmation sent to the insured and all documents archived.
All records related to the auto accident claim have been securely archived in the company system for future reference if needed.
